channel.title: BUbuisnessAndMarket
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbuisnessAndMarket, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Real estate CEO says the luxury industry is all about one thing: a ‘return on ego’
item.description: DarGlobal CEO Ziad El Chaar sees co-branded real estate—what he calls the “limited edition of real estate”—as both a cultural anchor and a magnet for ...

item.title: Everyone thinks AI is replacing factory workers, but Amazon’s layoffs show it’s coming for middle management first
item.description: As Amazon slashes 14,000 white-collar roles and the U.S. approaches a million job cuts this year, AI’s first major labor casualty might be emerging.

item.title: How Bupa’s CEO Iñaki Ereño woke a sleeping giant—and set a 100,000 strong workforce running toward digital health
item.description: How Bupa’s CEO balances triathlons, technology and the transformation of global health.

item.title: The Hollywood blueprint holds the key to reshaping organizations in the age of AI
item.description: The Hollywood model of work is a refreshing alternative to the rigid structures of the industrial era.

item.title: Saudi Arabia is now a nation of city-dwellers, and ‘cities don’t lie,’ says urban development leader
item.description: Also: All the news and watercooler chat from Fortune.

item.title: My employer enacted a tough new return-to-office policy. Should we fight back?
How a few new crypto ETFs slipped through the cracks of the government shutdown
Nvidia in premarket trade surpasses $5 trillion valuation
Stocks keep hitting record highs. Will Wednesday's big events change that?
